intro: Homeria collina var. miniata, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its drought tolerance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
